meanings.definition: The act of impacting or striking against something.
meanings.sent1: The impingements of the waves against the shore created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent2: The impingements of the hammer against the nail secured the frame in place.
meanings.sent3: The impingements of the raindrops on the window made a rhythmic melody.
meanings.sent4: The impingements of ideas in the brainstorming session led to a creative breakthrough.
meanings.sent5: The impingements of the basketball against the backboard echoed in the empty gym.

meanings.sent1: The impingements in the pipe caused a water leak in the basement.
meanings.sent2: The impingements of fallen branches on the road delayed traffic.
meanings.sent3: The impingements of the fallen leaves clogged the gutter like a natural dam.
meanings.sent4: The impingements of the fallen tree blocked the entrance to the hiking trail.
meanings.sent5: The impingements of the snow on the roof caused a collapse under the weight.

meanings.definition: A restriction or limitation on something.
meanings.sent1: The impingements on his freedom made him feel trapped.
meanings.sent2: The impingements on her creativity stifled her artistic expression.
meanings.sent3: The impingements on the budget forced them to rethink their plans.
meanings.sent4: The impingements on the project timeline required a revised schedule.
meanings.sent5: The impingements on their choices left them feeling constrained.
